title: Week 1
text:
Slides



1:00 - 1:30 : Overview of EDS 411, Capstone Project, and DIP
1:30 - 2:00: Client relations workshop - Miya Scheble, Bren School
2:00 - 2:05: BREAK
2:05 - 3:00: Communication roles activity
3:00 - 3:10: BREAK
3:10 - 3:50: Capstone project group roles, alias, and summary
3:50 - 4:00: Checklist for next class





Goals for first client meeting (to be held before next class):
‚òëÔ∏è Clarify what the objectives are (if you have any questions - know what they are before the meeting)
‚òëÔ∏è Address any issue with accessing data (determine beforehand what these might be)
‚òëÔ∏è Find out who the audience for your product will be and if there will be people who can test it
Before meeting the client meeting, develop an agenda, including:

who will be the meeting facilitator/chair and who will take notes
agenda (with times)
list of clarifying questions you want to ask the client
any questions about the data - make sure you know how to access it

After meeting: reflect with your team on how it went and what could be improved.




Read:
‚òëÔ∏è MEDS Capstone Project Guidelines, available at Bren‚Äôs Academic Resources webste
‚òëÔ∏è Sample DIPs
‚òëÔ∏è Ten simple rules to cultivate belonging in collaborative data science research teams
Prepare with your capstone team 3 slides covering:

An ultra summarized version of what your capstone project will do
The datasets you‚Äôll use
 One graph showing exploratory visualization of your data

Pick a person or two who are ready to do a 3 minute presentation next. class




Submit by 5pm on Tuesday 1/16: Project roles. Update them on the EDS 2024 Capstone Assignments
Submit by 5pm on Friday 1/19: Finalize your summary paragraph for Bren website, add to Capstone Summaries.  Your advisor must review your summary before submitting it.

title: EDS 411A: MEDS Capstone
text:
Welcome to the course materials for EDS 411A - MEDS Capstone! This course is part of the UCSB Masters in Environmental Data Science at the Bren School of Environmental Science and Mananagement.
In this website you will find the materials covered during lectures for the Winter 2024 term. This site will be under construction throughout the course.


The goal of EDS 411A is to facilitate student learning, work, and progress on their MEDS Capstone project through lessons, activities, supervised and unsupervised project work, and peer review and feedback. Additionally, EDS 411A provides opportunities for professional and career development (e.g.¬†presentation skills, writing and editing, client relations, team science, panel discussions, and conflict resolution).



Carmen Galaz Garc√≠a (she/her/hers)
E-mail: galaz-garcia@nceas.ucsb.edu
Office hour: by appointmnet, Zoom or NCEAS classroom
Best way to contact me: e-mail, Slack



Click here to view syllabus.



The following is our ideal calendar, the course content may be subject to change as the course progresses.




This website is created with Quarto and is published through GitHub pages. Click here to go to the website‚Äôs GitHub repository.

Submit by 5pm on Friday 1/19:
Finalize your summary paragraph for Bren website, add to Capstone Summaries.  Your advisor must review your summary before submitting it. 
Submit by 5pm on Tuesday 1/23:
Draft of DIP Team Management Plan section. Add document to the shared folder Week 2 - Team Management Plan draft.
Consider the following resources when writing the Team Management Plan:

MEDS Capstone Project Guidelines
Team‚Äôs project roles and responsibilities
Ten simple rules to cultivate belonging in collaborative data science research teams
Flexible communication roles among team members
Conflict resolution strategies
Dr.¬†Allison Horst‚Äôs Code of Conduct

Submit by 5pm on Tuesday 1/23:
Draft of DIP Problem Statement and Objectives Section and DIP Products & Deliverables Add document to the shared folder Week 2 - Problem & Objectives / Deliverables
Remember:

your team is responsible for reaching out to your client or advisor with any questions needed to clarify these sections
as needed, you can seek feedback from your advisor on your DIP sections before submitting a complete first draft on 2/9.
